We chose this place because it's one of the few sit down dim sum spots around, but probably would go somewhere else if I was looking for a Chinese breakfast.
author: Rachel M.

description:
I am overjoyed to have an authentic spot within walking distance. Clean, newly taken over location with friendly waiters. I can't wait to bring my friends & family here. The idea of Chinatown or Inner Richmond seems like a chore. Then followed by finding parking and crowds of people. It's a nice surprise to find the reasonable prices & tasty dishes close to my own neighborhood. They do accept credit cards. Also huge plus & peace of mind as I noticed the 94 Health score next to the checkout register !!! 
Good luck I hope you guys stay around
author: Sunnie H.

description: So, so good! I have been craving Egg Fu Yung for months! Not on the menu, they so graciously made it for me and it was the best I had ever had. My hubby had General Tso and it was full of chicken and veggies. Even though rice is sold separately, the value is there because the portions are huge. The staff was so sweet. The restaurant was lightly lit and very clean. We will def will come back.
author: Sherrie T.

description:
Really liked this place a lot especially considering it just opened up.  The dim sum was made to order versus the carts which I thought would be kind of a bummer but actually made for much better quality.  The value is great, the owner (Francis I think?) is very nice and the quality of the dim sum I would say is almost as good as Yank Sing for half the price.

I got pot stickers, baked pork buns (must have), lotus paste sesame balls, shrimp shu mai, everything was good, the baked pork buns were excellent.  Would give 5 stars but the service is always a little off (no water, etc) and there are usually fruit flies.   A little nit picky I know, but if those were fixed, it's 5 stars for sure.

Can't wait to go back.
author: Matt C.

description:
Given the wealth of dim sum options in SF, I'm surprised this place is so highly rated. The food is good but not amazing. Price is decent though - we paid $13 per person after tax and tip. Location is also convenient. Also some bonus points for being willing to take a bunch of credit cards without any complaints! 

What works here:
- fried shrimp dumplings
- noodle rolls with BBQ pork or shrimp
- pan fried shrimp and chive dumplings
- baked pork buns
- turnip cake

What's better elsewhere:
- Shumai: filling could be more flavorful
- shrimp dumplings: skin is too thick
- pork ribs in plum sauce: again not that flavorful 
- fried sesame balls: so few sesame seeds :(

Overall, would not go out of my way to eat again.
author: Han Z.

description:
I am so thrilled that we have an affordable food option in Russian Hill.  We have had our second experience and both times where spot on.  Fantastic service, great food and well priced.

I hope this place becomes a fixture!
author: Henry B.

description: It met my expectation in general. There was no waiting time. Dim sum was good with reasonable price. A lot of choices.
author: Stella S.

description:
Soo good!
So i am a huge fan of dim sum. its like the best type of meal. So i heard this place was open and had some pretty decent reviews so we checked it out.

It is in a hotel which is kinda weird...but ill take it. No alcohol...i like alcohol. But the food other wise was really tastey.

I was expecting some exciting extensive dim sum menu..but they did not have it. They did have a pretty good selection of pretty much everything you would need in a dim sum place. Shu Mui, shrimp dumplings, shanghai dumplings. All the good stuff. They had fried rice which was sooo delicious!!! We ended up getting tea instead of beer which is okay. Service was good as we were pretty much the only ones there. They would not give us little saucers for the soy sauce...but well chalk that up to the language barrier...which i am totally okay with. Over all li think this is is  great no frills place for really good dim sum on a quiet night. I am actually looking for to ordering from there again. Maybe take out:)
author: Ashley H.

description:
Everything was excellent-the food, the service, and no wait even during Sunday brunch hours.  I'd give it 4.5 stars if I could (but I am very stingy with 5-star ratings).

I didn't note this in other reviews, so I'll mention that this is a place where you order off a menu instead of choosing things from a cart.  This means everything is cooked to order and very fresh, but it loses some of the sense of adventure you get from picking surprise treats as they roll past.

Anyway, this is the real deal.  It's easy to see how this place made so many best-of lists.  We'll be back.
author: Sofia C.

description: This place is unexpected for sure. Although not your typical dim sum house, Dim sum club has excellent food! I don't know where they found their chef but he is amazing and I have been to a LOT of dim sum places growing up in the city. unlike most dim sum places, our party of 6 Got seated right away and the servers were very attentive to our needs. Order the shumai, BBQ pork wrapped in noodle and the bao. You must try this new place for dim sum!
author: Eve S.

description:
Really enjoyed this new place! They have really great quality food and I hope locals catch on. I first noticed the place when they were giving out free shrimp egg rolls as I walked by. It was AMAZING! Enough to make me come back.

I was a tad disappointed when I came back for dinner with my boyfriend that they did not currently have the shrimp egg rolls and had replaced them with veggie rolls. Still good, but I was craving the shrimp! Hopefully they bring them back :)

We also got broccoli, pot stickers, shrimp dumplings, kung po chicken, and steamed pork buns. All great! Definitely coming back!!
author: Alexandra W.

description: Great dim sum in an unassuming hotel lobby restaurant in the Cow Hollow/Van Ness corridor.  The soup dumplings were prepared to near perfection, just enough soup, just enough skin and just the right size.
author: Rafael R.

description: Everything was delicious & parking was much easier to find here than it was in the financial district or china town. Plus it's a low cleaner too. Food was delicious and service was great.
author: Denise P.

description:
This is a follow up to an earlier review where I also gave 5 stars and comented about the dim sum quality (as noted by how thin the skins are on the Shanghai soup dumplings - a sign of the chef's skill).  Only downside is that the menu is a bit more limited than some in Chinatown. 

Went back again today.  Still good dim sum.  Noticed that the service is much better than you would find in Chinatown - guess that is because their customers are about half non-chinese, who would not accept standard chinese service.  Starting to get more crowded - no wait at 12:30 on a Saturday, but the way things are going, likely will be lines at the most popular times before long.
author: Peter D.

description: Super delicious. Around the block from the Airbnb I stayed at when visiting San Francisco. This place has really yummy and authentic dim sum. The soup dumpings were delicious! I preferred all the steamed dishes over the fried dishes but that is just my opinion. Be careful when eating right away because we chowed down everything as it arrived to our table and nearly burned the roof of our mouths.
author: Debbie P.

description:
My first time here, much more convenient than fighting the crowds in Chinatown or Clement St. I love this spot, great service and food!!
Can't wait to go back.
author: JoAnn N.

description: The service was less than average, which is one of the reasons for my three star review. We asked for waters and waited about thirty minutes until they came, even though there were very few people in the restaurant at the time. The Shanghai dumplings were very tasty, however, and that certainly compensated for less than great service.
author: Serena L.

description: VERY unspectacular. We were excited about the high ratings and went here with high hopes on a Saturday night. Had read that they don't serve any alcohol, but they do appear to have wine at least. Pot stickers might have been the only mildly redeeming dish, but lemon chicken was completely soggy and inappropriately sticky/sweet, chow fun was bland and green beans tasted burnt but were tastelessly undercooked (who knows what "XO" sauce is - we were told it was garlic but I didn't taste any). Service was typical to this type of place, water was only filled upon request and we had to bag our own leftovers. This was a one time kind of place, and I wouldn't even recommend that.
author: Natalie H.

description:
Awesomely good food in an out-of-the-way location. 

They have a comprehensive menu. You can choose dim sum small plates to share, or larger entree-size portions. 

At lunchtime, my friend and I ordered several small plates, which are made to order. But there wasn't much of a wait for the first plates to arrive.

As others have noted, the place can get quite warm because the cooking takes place in the same space as the dining. And it doesn't rate very high on 'ambience' but is truly authentic; it's all about the food.
author: Daphne O.

description: You can enjoy the excellent variety and great taste of a Cantonese tea house lunch with out waiting as in the usual crowded restaurants of Chinatown. Go try it yourself soon. Open 7 days a week.
author: Ellen D C.

description:
Cannot get enough of tihs place!  SOOOO GOOD!!!  Love the variety and the prices, and the service is quick and friendly.  It's dangerous that I live a block away.

Definitely try the:

--preserved egg porridge
--stuffed eggplant (stuffed with shrimp)
--curry chicken
--kung pao chicken
--house noodles
--fried rice
--steamed pork bao
--curry samosas
--mango pudding for dessert
author: Dena M.

description: I love this place - fast service, no lines, and the only decent dim sum place in nob hill/marina area. The beef congee is amazing, comes with fried doughnuts.
author: Gina H.

description: The dim sum club is a good place to eat breakfast, service isn't too bad and they have a fast meal for us.  It was a really great dim sum restaurant that Ive never eaten before (even Hong Kong) . After I  ate,I  gonna have a nice day.
author: Shih Ting W.

description:
Maybe im a "yum cha" snob so this is what I think how a good tea house should be. Ok let me break it down for you: 
First the tea should always be boiling hot. It should be so hot that once you pour the tea in the cup you cant quickly drink it you have to slowly sip it becuase dim sum is some heavy shit. You would feel shitty eating dim sum with out drinking hot tea. Does dim sum club serve tea like that? Nope. To top it off, the tea pot that they gave us was disgusting looking. It had that dried out tea scum all over the top. Come on man!! You are not a hole in the wall place ok. If you going to charge me for tea, you best clean that shit up! U know wat im sayin!!

Ok. Now lets move on to the dim sum. First of all, there's not too much variety to choose from. Its just your basic dim sum. You would think they would get it right? Wrong!!! We ordered cilantro churng fun, leuy sa tong yoon, loh bak goh, fung jau, loh mai gai, and seafood jook. The churng fun(rice noodle w/cilantro) was ok but the sweet soyu they used was a lil off. So that was wacked. The leuy sa tong yoon(mochi w/sweet sesame filling was horrible. The mochi part wasnt fresh and the filling was dddrrry!! Wacked. The loh bak goh(daikon cake) just tasted like flour. Wacked. The fung jau(chicken feet) was saaaaalty!!! Wickety wacked!! The loh mai gai (steamed sticky rice) was ok but very oily. Sorta wacked. The only thing that i actually liked  was the seafood jook (rice soup). The consistency was good and the seafood was fresh. Yhat was worth 2stars. This place should be called the jook club.

For those yelpers that gives this place more than 3stars, shame on you!! This place is WACKED!!!
author: RICKY C.

description: I was a huge fan of this place when it first opened up, however quality has since gone way down. There are always flies in their soy sauce containers (ew) and their food isn't as good. The soup dumplings we ordered tonight were all broken and soup-less :/ It's a great addition to the neighborhood but they need to get their act together!
author: Maria Y.

description: My boyfriend and I journeyed over 2 miles of SF hills on an empty stomach to get to this place and it was worth every step. Probably the best siu mai and hargow I've ever had. We decided this place should be our new dim sum staple. The servers were friendly and attentive (exact opposite of those nasty women at Daimo). Everything tasted really fresh and the they did not skimp on the filling. Not like some of the other places where you get more dough than filling. The place was clean and not too busy so it was easy to get a table. I would like to come back and try it again when I'm not absolutely starving so that I don't shovel everything into my face.
author: Gaby R.

description: I came by myself for lunch since I was craving dim sum and it was right before they were going to go on break. The food is not bad at all, however, the selection is really limited, no joke. I order the beef ball, siu mai, ha gao, sticky rice wrapped in a leaf, and turnip cakes. I already know what you are all thinking.... I order too much for just one person, a 5'1, 105 lb girl. Yes, yes I did. I managed to finish 2 and whatever was left over was for dinner that day. The food is not bad, but I left feeling unsatisfied due to the lack in variety. If you don't mind limited selection, this is your spot for dim sum. The service was better than your typical Chinese restaurant, thank God. The place is also quite clean on the inside, which so far,I have found as a rarity here.
author: Jeniece C.

description: Bad. Horrible food. Got the lemon chicken and it was not good. Also the kung pow chicken and the tofu and chicken. Don't get.
author: Morgan M.

description: Really good quality. The food came out quick...one of the best dim sum spots I've been to...
author: Jenee D.

description: Dim Sum Club is simply amazing. From the delicious dim sum selection, all made to order, to the scrumptious lunch and dinner plates -- this place has it going on! For under $15 per person you can feast on some quality Chinese food. These are some of our favorite dishes so far: Kung Pao Chicken, Pork Jook, Stuffed Eggplant, Curried Samosa, Fried Onion Pancake. I can't wait to try the Shanghai Dumplings (XLB) on our next meal.
author: Drew W.

description: I had high hopes for this place. It was average for the price point. Had the hot and sour soup, shanghai dumplings, dim sum plate (hai gow, siu mai, bbq pork bun, veggie spring roll and it usually comes with the sesame dumplings but they ran out so they provided additional siu mai as a substitute) and pork pot stickers.  Plus, they have little flies that just won't go away. I actually killed one on my plate and left it there to see if they would say anything since they were watching me swat them away during my entire dinner there. When they cleared the plate, they saw the dead fly and said nothing.
author: S C.

description:
The short: Dim Sum was requested last minute and wandered in on a whim and WOW!!! I think I'm going to crave this for a long time to come.

The long: I hate to write this review because I want it to stay a unknown secret. Had family coming into town and they had been saying they had to go to San Fran while they were in town, but couldn't tell me ANYTHING that they just really wanted to do there. Until they got there and at the last minute rattled off their requests after we parked halfway across town from anything they wanted to do. Yeah I was pulling my hair out. So after doing a few stops they tossed out they wanted dim sum and I fired up my trusty Yelp app. Well all the touristy spots were far away, but there was this new and hot place with a lot of amazing reviews and it was close. Away we went. The place is kind of one of those places you would walk right by and never see if you were not looking for it. Once we got inside it was full of ethnic diners which is an amazing sign in my book. We got sat and given a menu and we scribbled out everything we wanted and just waited. There were 6 of us in total and we all ordered about 3-4 items a piece not really knowing what to expect. Then the food came. Oh crap we ordered WAY too much. We worked our way through the waves of food that came to the table and not a single thing was complained about. Everyone loved everything and we had at least a good 15 different items on the table. We were expecting a heart attack when the ticket came and we were right it took my breath away. For the feast of yummy goods we got our total bill was just under $30. I thought it had to be a mistake but everything was on the bill. I will definitely be coming back here on my next time in the area.

What works: AMAZING food and insane prices. As a bonus it isn't loaded with tourists so no screaming babies or people complaining because they didn't know what they were in for.

What to improve: Service was a little slow to get going and there seemed to be a communication problem, but nothing that couldn't be overlooked.
author: Patrick M.

description: I had a good experience here - it's Chinatown food without the Chinatown prices, ambiance, annoyance, and service. It is mildly pricey but I do love that everything was made to order. I would like to see more things on the menu though. Overall, it was not bad - food and service were good and it definitely satisfied the Dim Sum craving. Finally a decent Dim Sum place for this side of town!
author: Sandy T.

description: The food here is original Chinese. The chef here must be really good. I recommend everyone who want to try original Chinese food try here. The pepper sauce is original. It's just top notch food.
author: Lizhi K.

description: Honestly, I wasn't expecting much of this place. The people hanging out outside the hotel portion were kind of sketchy but once we sat down and ordered, my mind was totally changed. The food was fantastic. Not the cheapest dim sum around. In Chinatown you could probably get the same amount of food for a lot less but you also won't get angry stares if you don't speak Chinese. Everything tasted great and the service was super fast. I'd definitely recommend this place.
author: Kahyo E.

description: The food was tasty, I really enjoyed the dim sum platter! I loved the sesame balls. So tasty and all for 10 dollars. The service was very friendly and although their English was not perfect it was effective.
author: A T.

description: Delicious food. Friendly service. Clean restaurant with lots of staff. It seems like they good your dim sum as you order it, so everything is very fresh. They have a good selection of dim sum and even a good selection of vegetarian items (which is important in this neighborhood). The sesame balls for dessert were superb.
author: Natalie S.

description: Dim Sum Club was good..not just good for the area, located on the outskirts of Marina where you wouldn't expect good ethnic food, but good compared to some of the best dim sum you can get in the city. The big difference between this and many others I've been to is the fact  that you can taste all/most of the food is freshly made rather than sitting around for hours. I selfishly hope they stay in business but not get too popular such that the food quality goes down or the wait is long. To top it all off, the staff is very attentive and friendly; things you rarely get at dim sum!
author: Jeff N.

description: Love the siumai's and porridge. Great duck too!! their dim sum is as good as yanksing but less expensive. Great service too.  Sesame balls are delish.
author: ThuZ W.

description:
I've done takeout a few times here- reasonably priced & consistently good.
Shanghai dumplings, shrimp dumplings, eggplant with shrimp, and salt pepper chicken wings are all excellent. Wonton soup is very good. Chinese broccoli & steamed pork buns are just ok- broccoli was a little undercooking & buns taste a little too doughy. 
All in all, a great addition to the takeout options in the neighborhood!!
author: Maggie Z.

description:
This is right next door. I have seen it be various failed restaurants, so I hesitated to try it. But, I did this week, and it is WONDERFUL. The dim sum is fresh and delicious--the shrimp are not defrosted. The sesame balls are the best i've had anywhere. 

I highly recommend this place. Delicious food.
author: Lady L.

description: Great food and excellent service!  Last time we walked all the way from Chinatown because we thought parking might be critical. But actually parking is not hard to find. So we drove here this time and easily parked our car. It's quite busy around noon time. But love their dim sum! Will defintely come back again!
author: YueLi Y.

description: Don't let the facade fool you... The food here is very good!
author: Scott H.

description: Excellent crispy duck, fried taro, shrimp & chive dim sum, and coconut/red bean dessert.
author: Inigo M.

description: I stumbled upon this amazing dim sum place by chance one day and have been back regularly. This place wins in quality, price, service, and cleanliness. Definitely worth going to for a fantastic dim sum experience! It's he best I've had in SF.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I had a pretty terrible experience there. The service was incredibly slow. We had to ask multiple times for water. The food itself was mediocre at best. One item that we ordered was literally inedible and we asked them to take it back and refund us to which they just flat out said no. Poor customer service if you ask me.
author: Alison M.

description:
Solid place. Not as good as Great Eastern in my opinion.

Get Shanghai dumplings, shrimp dumplings, and shrimp noodle roll. Egg rolls were solid as well.
Overall, just not a spectacular place but good value and easy walk to in the neighborhood.
author: Dave C.

description: Good dim sum at a great price in the neighborhood! I've had better, but nothing beats the location!
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Wonderful experience this morning at dim sum club! The owner Francis was very hospitable.

Left full, portion sizes were bigger than expected and everything was tasty. We ordered :

Shrimp and chive dumpling pan fried, pan fried pot stickers, half roasted duck, shanghai dumpling, salt and pepper calamari, salt and pepper spare ribs, and hot tea.  We went out last night and after a night of drinking there is nothing like yummy dim sum. So glad you moved to the neighboorhood... Welcome!
author: Elizabeth G.

description: This place is legit.  There are real Chinese peeps in there so that must be a good sign.  Dim sum was very good (not as good as Koi Palace good) but pretty decent.  Service was fine.  Prices on par.  I thought some of the portion sizes were big compared to other chinese dim sum places.  It was just a little hot in there temperature wise - they need to turn on the a/c or a fan especially on a warm day (schweatty!).
author: Mr. C.

description: Delicious entrees, fresh ingredients, friendly staff. No pretentiousness but high quality food and relaxed environment, very enjoyable! We will return!
author: Jeanne S.

description: This place rocks they offer basic dim sum items but it was so tasty made as you ordered it was fresh tasty service was good,manager or owner came out check on us. Been to other dim sum places in China town even Koi Palace in Daly City but Dim Sum Club will be my go to place when I visit from Texas.
author: David S.

description: Great find. We are vacationing and had a craving for dim sum in the evening. Instead of rushing to china town, find parking and beat the closing time, we took a chance with this restaurant and the dim sum was delicious!!
author: Rachelle O.

description: Excellent Dim Sum!  The duck was outstanding and xio long pao was the best!  Definitely going to come again!
author: Sandra B.

description:
We were first time customers.....the place seems clean and spacious.  Mostly empty tables and
yet service is still slow.  The main problem I see is that the help speaks little or no English
and it is very hard to communicate without repeating yourself and not understanding
what the help is saying.  

Food is okay, but we found the chow mein a little pricey for what you get which was more noodles than the main ingredients and also a bit too oily.  Dim sum was okay, good but nothing great.  All items have the same identical price, which is strange.

There is a great opportunity for them to do very well here, but they seem to lack the know how of running a business and need to hire English speaking help....because most all of their customers only understand English.  They also need to reevaluate their pricing.
The menu does not clearly describe the dishes they offer and so it is super important
that you have a waitress that speaks English to clearly describe what you are getting.
Was hoping to make this one of our favorite Chinese food eating place, but we were left disappointed.
author: Girly Foodie F.

description: i think it might have been the best Dim Sum I ate in California.  I've tried place in Monterrey Park and San Gabriel but I liked this place better.  Everything was really good.  Give this place a try when your in San Francisco.
author: Mark H.

description:
Recently moved to Russian Hill and needed a dim sum/Chinese restaurant that wouldn't be too inconvenient to walk to. Found this gem and enjoyed it. Great place to go to if Chinatown is out of the way. 

Pro: 
Dim sum options available for dinner 
Clean 
BBQ pork bun was awesome 
Good quality food 

Con: 
Wish that dim sum was available all day

Will definitely be going back.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Very disappointing.  I read the reviews and they made this place sound like it was worth checking out.  

The dim sum is sub par.  Very small menu and the dim sum was not good.  Will not go back
author: Beth K.

description: first time here. it was great! craving dim sum? eat here! the bbq pork buns and shrimp dumplings are my favorite. no long waits and the food comes quick!
author: Cake L.

description: I really wanted to like this place but this is NOTHING like Yank Sing but also much worse that average Dim Sum available in San Francisco.  I hate giving bad reviews but you can taste the MSG and the food actually made me feel ill.
author: william c.

description: Fast service Still food has too much fat and not tasty. Missing description of dishes. Waitress does not speak well English.
author: Yannick L.

description:
I'm a pretty big Chinese food snob. I mean, I like the Americanized stuff like Panda Express but it's not Chinese food. I always tell everyone about how disappointed I am by Chinese food in San Francisco for being Americanized under the guise of authentic and expensive. I'm from the San Gabriel Valley of southern California where good Chinese food is everywhere because the population is so densely Chinese. I have always said and maintain that the worst Chinese restaurant there would be one of the best here. Long story short, I've eaten a lot of Chinese food in my life and a lot of dim sum.

I was shocked to find that a pretty legit Chinese place (with dim sum, no less!) had opened half a block from me and in a shady touristy hotel I ass daily. I was skeptical at first but the good reviews inspired me to take a stab at it.

I tried it out for lunch and I pleasantly surprised. Here's what I got to go:
- salted pork bone rice porridge - huge portion and comes with fried cruller (you tiao), green onions and pickled stuff on the side. It was delicious and I greatly appreciated the condiments. The meat was on the bone and very flavorful. The porridge itself had a lot of green onions and other greens in it already, so in the future I may request green onions on the side only if it's possible. 
- black bean chicken feet - yeah, I'm THAT Chinese. It was a good portion for the price and was very flavorful. In restaurants, it usually comes with more sauce but it may just be because I got it to go. It was also cut up into smaller pieces than it's usually served but that's not a big deal.
- salted custard buns - it was as advertised but still not what I expected. The saltiness was not what i had anticipated but it was in the description so it was my own fault. I still ate it and thought it was good.

The staff was very nice and helpful when I asked questions. The packaging is very nice, especially for a Chinese restaurant. The prices are pretty good, especially for San Francisco. How do I get those free pineapple buns though!?

Would love to try dining in and testing out the other dishes. So far though, VERY promising and perfect to scratch my dim sum itch in between visits to LA.
author: K C.

description: This place has really tasty, fresh dim sum.  The bbq pork buns (baked), siu mai, shanghai dumplings(xiao long bao/soup dumplings), and scallion pancakes were all amazing.
author: Joel S.

description: GREAT food, great service (with a smile and what seems like a genuine desire to provide a good experience), and a strange location....but not a bad one.  As a bonus, it's terrific to have such a high quality dim sum restaurant in a different part of town. Okay, it's my part of town, but nonetheless.....only thing is it's a bit noisy in there -- it was half full when we were in for lunch, and we had to speak loudly to hear each other.  But who cares? As soon as the food arrived -- which was very soon indeed -- no one wanted to talk any more!
author: Mini N.

description: My wife and I ordered half Imperial Peking Duck, and we were pleasantly surprised by the quality and taste of what we got. Particularly, the duck skin had been well prepared, since all the fat under the skin were carefully removed before serving. We also tried Beef w/ Cilantro Noodle Roll, Egglpant w/ Black Bean Sauce, Bean Curd Roll w/ Oyster Sauce, and Bean Curd Skin Roll w/ Shrimp. We like all of them. Overall, we would rate the taste of the food in Dim Sum Club one of the best in San Francisco.
author: Dan S.

description:
DSC was a big disappointment.
We come once a year to SF for a foodie trip and dim sum is one of our favorite food particularly in SF. We were so glad to hear about "good" dim sum place in the area where we stay and did have our hopes high.
 But our experience was not good at all and we are so sorry to waste our money and time here.
The taste of the food was very mediocre. Eatable but nothing flavorful or interesting about it. The choices are very limited.
The service was ridiculous. Trying to be" more modern" then the regular places of Chinatown, but at the same time not knowing elementary rules about servicing the client. Our waitress literally took it as an insult when we tried to ask her to bring extra little spoons for the vinegar that comes with XLB. We HAD to explain to her WHY do we need it and even after the explanation she acted like we hurt her feelings and she was kind of rude for the rest of the time. Probably couldn't wait for us to leave as soon as possible. We also observed how she was acting towards other patrons commending them to the seats she chooses for them, not the ones they pointed out to her were they would like to sit. And BTW the whole room had only 2 tables occupied. Very impolite. 
Finally the value of the meal was WAY overpriced for the quality of the experience.
Too bad we didn't take in to consideration the negative reviews points.
Needless to say we are not going to be back or recommend this place to anyone.
author: Tatyana M.

description: Very good dim sum, and unexpected for the location. Not just "good for the location", but actually at the upper end of SF dim sum.
